results.title: People in chains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Talks with people who have faced the dilemma of whether to sacrifice themselves looking after dependent relatives or hand the responsibility to the authorities. They have chosen the way of family loyalty, a strangely strong call of duty. The problem of dependents is one which has concerned society for a long time. In the end the responsibility lies with the individual - a member of the family. They are the “people in chains”.

results.title: People here really aren't idiots
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Tristram Miall
results.brief_description: The work of a halfway house in Sydney, providing accommodation for young people referred from other agencies such as prisons and psychiatric hospitals. The residents stay for approximately a year, find a job, pay rent, and find in the house a stable environment to help them over the acute stages of adjustment, with the opportunity to interact amongst themselves and with outsiders.

results.title: People count
results.creator_credit: Visual Media and Australian Bureau of Statistics
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the 1981 Census and shows how information from the Census can help people make informed decisions about most things that touch their lives. Also explains how the Bureau of Statistics turns the personal details of nearly fifteen million people into purely anonymous statistics. No other credits available.

results.title: People by the billions
results.creator_credit: Donald Faser and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth and mankind”.
Examines the implications of the population explosion, showing that “standing room only” on our planet may become a possibility as the human race increases. A fanciful notion today, migration to another planet may hold the only hope five hundred years from now.

results.title: People are the main part of any deal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Boss Class”.
In part Two the problems of management are further discussed with particular reference to industrial relations, training and consultation of staff and fringe benefits. Summarises three problems facing industry - innovation, computerisation and containerisation.

results.title: People are different
results.brief_description: Made during one term’s evening classes at a London County Council institute. It shows how differently, in learning to paint, people approach the same subject; how differently they handle materials; and how, having gained confidence in themselves, they are able to work effectively on group painting.
